SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc19
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Networking.Server.ServerRMI

Class MainServerRMI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Networking.Server.Server
it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Networking.Server.ServerRMI.MainServerRMI
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualMainServer, Remote
public class MainServerRMI extends Server implements VirtualMainServer
It's the main server for RMI. It extends Server and implements VirtualMainServer in order to RMI clients to connect. It handles first connection, game creation or join, explicit disconnection, reconnection and heartbeats.

  • Field Summary

    • newConnection

      public void newConnection(VirtualClient clientRMI, String nickName) throws RemoteException
      This method is used to establish a new RMI connection between client and server. We must check if clientRMI is already connected to server. If no, server generates a token (hash of and ClientHandlerRMI) and inserts it in CreatedPlayerMessage. Token will be used during reconnection. Then, it registers first heartbeat in lastHeartBeatOfClient and starts thread for checking .
      Specified by:
      newConnection in interface VirtualMainServer
      Parameters:
      clientRMI - virtual client of player who wants to create a connection
      nickName - nickname chosen by the player
      Throws:
      RemoteException - exception thrown if something goes wrong

    • createGame

      public VirtualGameServer createGame(VirtualClient clientRMI, String gameName, String nickName, int numPlayer) throws RemoteException
      This method is the entry point for creating a game. If MainController.createGame(String, int, ClientHandler) returns true then builds all is needed server-side for managing the client. Player has to be registered to server in order to create a new game.
      Specified by:
      createGame in interface VirtualMainServer
      Parameters:
      clientRMI - virtual client of the player
      gameName - name of the game to build
      nickName - nickname of the player
      numPlayer - number of player for the game
      Returns:
      a VirtualGameServer remote object from which the client can access the game. If a game cannot be built it returns null.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - exception thrown if something goes wrong

    • createGame

      public VirtualGameServer createGame(VirtualClient clientRMI, String gameName, String nickName, int numPlayer, long randomSeed) throws RemoteException
      This method acts the same as createGame(VirtualClient, String, String, int) but lets the user choose the seed on which build the game
      Specified by:
      createGame in interface VirtualMainServer
      Parameters:
      clientRMI - virtual client of player creating the game
      gameName - game name chosen by the player
      nickName - nickname of the player
      numPlayer - number of player for the specified game
      randomSeed - random seed for the game
      Returns:
      a VirtualGameServer remote object from which the client can access the game. If a game cannot be built it returns null.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - exception thrown if something goes wrong

    • joinGame

      public VirtualGameServer joinGame(VirtualClient clientRMI, String gameName, String nickName) throws RemoteException
      This method is the entry point for client who wants to join a game. If MainController.registerToGame(ClientHandler, String) goes fine it exports ClientHandlerRMI object and returns a reference to it.
      Specified by:
      joinGame in interface VirtualMainServer
      Parameters:
      clientRMI - virtual client associated to the requesting player
      gameName - name of the game
      nickName - nickname of the requesting player
      Returns:
      a VirtualGameServer remote object from which the client can access the game. If a game cannot be built it returns null.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - exception thrown if something goes wrong

      Throws:
      RemoteException - exception thrown if something goes wrong

    • reconnect

      public VirtualGameServer reconnect(VirtualClient clientRMI, String nickName, String token) throws RemoteException
      This method support advanced functionality resilience to disconnection. It checks if client is already connected to server (in other words if it correctly sends heartbeats). If yes, reconnection is no needed. Otherwise, it is necessary to check tokens. If there is another VirtualClient with the same token in connectedClients then reconnection can take place. Otherwise, requesting player is faking to be some other and it returns null. Lastly, it exports the new game server and insert first heartbeat inside lastHeartBeatOfClients.
      Specified by:
      reconnect in interface VirtualMainServer
      Parameters:
      clientRMI - virtual client of the player who wants to reconnect
      nickName - nickname of client
      token - private token of the client
      Returns:
      VirtualGameServer remote object of the game server
      Throws:
      RemoteException - exception thrown if something goes wrong

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(VirtualClient clientRMI, String nickName) throws RemoteException
      This method disconnects one client from the RMI server. Client must explicitly tell to server that he wants to be disconnected. It removes from both connectedClients and lastHeartBeatOfClients. Finally, it tells to MainController to disconnect the player and send to player a DisconnectFromServerMessage.
      Specified by:
      disconnect in interface VirtualMainServer
      Parameters:
      clientRMI - virtual client of the player who wants to be disconnected
      nickName - is the nickname of the requesting client
      Throws:
      RemoteException - exception thrown if something goes wrong

    • runHeartBeatTesterForClient

      protected void runHeartBeatTesterForClient()
      Description copied from class: Server
      This method is used to check heart beat timing of connected clients. If client do not send heart beat message for more than Settings.MAX_DELTA_TIME_BETWEEN_HEARTBEATS it deletes it from lastHeartBeatOfClients hashmap, it sets it to inactive using MainController.setPlayerInactive(String). It doesn't remove it from connectedClients hashmap because client can reconnect, and thus it is necessary to keep its private token.
      Specified by:
      runHeartBeatTesterForClient in class Server

    • disconnectFromGame

      public void disconnectFromGame(VirtualClient clientRMI, String nickname) throws RemoteException
      This method is used by RMI clients that want to exit the game where they are actually in. To do that, it uses MainController.disconnectPlayerFromGame(ClientHandler).
      Specified by:
